intro: Harpanema acuminatum, commonly known as the sharp-pointed harpanema, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, climbing habit and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often borne in the axils of the leaves. Its fruits are small berries that turn red when mature, containing several seeds. Harpanema acuminatum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
